citation.article-title: Negativicoccus succinicivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from human clinical samples, emended description of the family Veillonellaceae and description of Negativicutes classis nov., Selenomonadales ord. nov. and Acidaminococcaceae fam. nov. in the bacterial phylum Firmicutes
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Negativicoccus [Ne.ga.ti.vi.cocâ€²cus. L. adj. negativus negative; N.L. masc. n. coccus (from Gr. masc. n. kokkos) grain or berry; N.L. masc. n. Negativicoccus coccus with a typical Gram-negative cell wall structure with an outer membrane observed by electron microscopy].
Characteristics of the genus are as described below for the type and only species N. succinicivorans.
Can be differentiated from other genera of the family Veillonellaceae by metabolic end products, and 16S rRNA gene and dnaK sequencing.
The type species is Negativicoccus succinicivorans.
